com.receiver2d.engine.geometry

Class CollisionDetection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.receiver2d.engine.geometry.CollisionDetection

  • public class CollisionDetection
extends Object
    Deals with analyzing collisions between geometric figures in two-dimensional space. This comes in handy for all sorts of things pertaining to the game engine, such as AI and physics.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CollisionDetection() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static boolean checkCollides(Circle c1, Circle c2)
      Determines if two circles are colliding (intersecting).
      static boolean checkCollides(Polygon poly1, Polygon poly2)
      Returns a true/false value determining whether or not two polygons or lines collide.
      static Vector2D[] circleIntersect(Circle c1, Circle c2)
      Determines the points of intersection between two overlapping circles.
      static Vector2D linesIntersect(Polygon ln1, Polygon ln2)
      Checks whether or not two finite lines collide, and if they do, returns the point of their collision as a Vector2D.
      static boolean pointInPolygon(Vector2D pt, Polygon poly)
      Determines if a point is inside a polygon using a ray casting algorithm.
      static Vector2D[] polyIntersect(Polygon polyA, Polygon polyB)
      Checks whether two polygons collide.
      static int setDefaultVerticeCount(int v)
      Sets the maximum number of vertices returned by the circleIntersectionPoints method, in the event that two circles lie on the same point and have the same radius.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CollisionDetection

        public CollisionDetection()

    • Method Detail

      • setDefaultVerticeCount

        public static int setDefaultVerticeCount(int v)
        Sets the maximum number of vertices returned by the circleIntersectionPoints method, in the event that two circles lie on the same point and have the same radius.
        Parameters:
        v - The maximum number of vertices (v >= 3).
        Returns:
        The new value of the maximum number of vertices.

      • linesIntersect

        public static Vector2D linesIntersect(Polygon ln1,
                      Polygon ln2)
        Checks whether or not two finite lines collide, and if they do, returns the point of their collision as a Vector2D.
        Parameters:
        ln1 - An array containing two points on the first line.
        ln2 - An array containing two points on the second line.
        Returns:
        A point of intersection, or null if the lines do not intersect.

      • polyIntersect

        public static Vector2D[] polyIntersect(Polygon polyA,
                       Polygon polyB)
        Checks whether two polygons collide. Polygons are defined as an array of vertices with each vertex (Vector2f) connected to the next one in the array.

        Example: square - (0,0) (0,1) (1,1) (1,0)

        Parameters:
        polyA - The array of points for the first polygon.
        polyB - The array of points for the second polygon.
        Returns:
        The array of points where the two polygons overlap, or null if they do not collide at all.

      • checkCollides

        public static boolean checkCollides(Polygon poly1,
                    Polygon poly2)
        Returns a true/false value determining whether or not two polygons or lines collide.
        Parameters:
        poly1 - An array containing points of the first polygon/line.
        poly2 - An array containing points of the second polygon/line.
        Returns:
        "true" if the polygons collide; "false" otherwise

      • pointInPolygon

        public static boolean pointInPolygon(Vector2D pt,
                     Polygon poly)
        Determines if a point is inside a polygon using a ray casting algorithm. If the point is on the edge of the polygon, the calculation returns false. See http://www.ecse.rpi.edu/~wrf/Research/Short_Notes/pnpoly.html
        Parameters:
        pt - A point.
        poly - An array of points, or a polygon.
        Returns:
        A true/false value depending on whether or not the point is inside the polygon.

      • checkCollides

        public static boolean checkCollides(Circle c1,
                    Circle c2)
        Determines if two circles are colliding (intersecting).
        Parameters:
        c1 - The first circle.
        c2 - The second circle.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the circles are colliding.

      • circleIntersect

        public static Vector2D[] circleIntersect(Circle c1,
                         Circle c2)
        Determines the points of intersection between two overlapping circles.
        Parameters:
        c1 - The first circle.
        c2 - The second circle.
        Returns:
        The points of intersection, or null if the circles do not intersect.
